data.description:

As part of our expansion into pregnancy support, we‚Äôre looking for a compassionate, proactive, and clinically experienced Pregnancy Care Expert to guide members and support our team with world-class care.

  • Assist members in identifying the right fertility clinic or service provider, schedule appointments, and provide ongoing concierge support.
  • Address member inquiries, proactively researching and presenting high-quality solutions tailored to their unique needs.
  • Conduct in-depth research on country-specific legislation and medical landscapes related to fertility, pregnancy, and menopause.
  • Audit and support the creation of pregnancy care content to ensure accuracy and relevance.
  • Help to train and mentor Member Care Experts to strengthen their knowledge of pregnancy and fertility care.
  • Regularly update our platform‚Äôs knowledge databases with the latest information on relevant healthcare practices and legal frameworks.

Requirements

Key Skills

  • Customer Service: Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both verbally and in writing.
  • Empathy: High emotional intelligence, a compassionate approach, and a genuine passion for supporting people through sensitive life stages.
  • Adaptability: Quick learner who embraces new topics and continuously expands knowledge in fertility, adoption, and surrogacy.
  • Organisation: Excellent attention to detail, strong prioritisation skills, and proven ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines in a fast-paced setting.
  • Collaboration: Thrives both independently and in a team, with a proactive, solutions-focused mindset.
  • Diversity & Inclusion: Commitment to supporting people from diverse backgrounds, especially in fertility and family-forming journeys.

What We‚Äôre Looking For

  • Certified midwife or registered fertility nurse with hands-on patient experience.
  • Confident, kind, and communicative, with a natural ability to make people feel at ease.
  • Comfortable in collaborative, dynamic environments.
  • Experienced in, or highly interested in, virtual care and digital health.

Bonus Points

  • Knowledge of global pregnancy practices.
  • Experience in a customer care role.

Language Skills

  • Fluent in English (spoken and written).
  • Fluency in at least one of: Hebrew, Italian, or German.
  • Additional fluency in these languages is a strong plus.

  • üí™ Urban sports club membership discount

data.title: Senior Software Engineer (m/f/x)
data.description:
About gocomo

As a Senior Software Engineer (m/f/x) at gocomo, you will play a key role in advancing and scaling our product. You will work across the full tech stack ‚Äì from building user-facing features in React, to designing robust APIs with NestJS, to optimizing Postgres databases and AWS infrastructure. This role is perfect for an experienced engineer who enjoys solving complex problems, values maintainability and scalability, and thrives in cross-functional collaboration to deliver high-impact solutions.

Your mission

  • Develop and maintain full-stack features using React, NestJS, and Postgres
  • Architect and optimize APIs, including integrations (e.g., Instagram API)
  • Manage Postgres databases, migrations, and performance optimization
  • Contribute to AWS infrastructure, CI/CD pipelines, and monitoring solutions
  • Collaborate closely with product, design, and engineering teams on scope, priorities, and UX
  • Ensure code quality, security best practices, and maintainable, reusable solutions

data.title: Interim Engineering Manager (all genders) - Wikibase Cloud - 12-month contract
data.description:
At Wikimedia Deutschland e.V. we help create, collect and distribute free knowledge. In 2004, volunteer Wikipedia activists founded the non-profit association Wikimedia Deutschland in Berlin, which now consists of over 110,000 members and 180 full-time staff.

Free knowledge leads to a fairer world. Wikipedia is the most important online knowledge collection of our time. The German Wikipedia alone records almost 1 billion page views per month for a total of 3 million articles. We - Wikimedia Deutschland e. V. - support the volunteers of Wikipedia and its sister projects, develop free software, such as Wikidata, and advocate for free access to knowledge, the opening of education and research, and more common good orientation in data policy.

Tasks

For our Software & Development Department, based in Berlin, we are looking for an Interim Engineering Manager (all genders), full-time (32 - 40 hours/week) as soon as possible for a 12-month contract.

This position is designed as a hybrid working model with regular presence in our Berlin office.

We seek an experienced Interim Engineering Manager (all genders) to join our Software & Development Department for a 12-month contract to lead the Wikibase Cloud Engineering Team while their Engineering Manager is unavailable for a longer period of time. This position is primarily people management, focusing on our developers' personal and professional growth, with an understanding of evaluating and suggesting improvements to engineering processes.

Wikibase Cloud is a collaborative space for individuals and groups to contribute, edit, and curate information in a structured way to help you transform your data into meaningful knowledge. Wikibase Cloud makes it easy and quick to host your Wikibase with no need for your own infrastructure. Wikibase Cloud opens the doors to efficient data management, sharing, and discovering insights in a collaborative environment.

Wikimedia Deutschland's Software Development department includes seven different product teams working on Wikidata, Wikibase, Technical Wishes, and Fundraising Technology. Our tasks include live platform operations, backend maintenance, feature development, cloud services, testing procedures and analysis, API development, and systems maintenance to integrate various services with our Wikimedia websites.

The engineering manager mentors and leads a team of software engineers who improve our products‚Äô software, which includes developing new features, maintaining existing features and infrastructure, as well as supporting the annual and strategic goals.

Responsibilities

  • Lead the team of six Wikibase Cloud engineers, build features that support the development of this product team, enabling our communities to achieve their visions.
  • Support engineers, product managers, community communication & partnership managers, researchers, and designers in building products and services used by hundreds of millions of people around the world.
  • Collaborate with other engineering managers and functional team leads on development, technical guidance, and engineering processes.
  • Evaluate engineering processes and provide suggestions for improvement to Engineering and Product Leadership.
  • As the Interim Engineering Manager, you will mentor an existing engineering team while supporting the personal and professional growth of our engineers.
  • Mentor and support the engineering team to maintain a high work and life quality, build trust within the engineering and product teams, while fostering adoption of new ideas.
  • Support the teams to align development with the values and goals of the organisation.
  • Represent team members within the organisation and our communities.
  • Coordinate with other WMDE product teams and organisational departments.

Requirements

  • Experience as an inclusive team engineering leader within a collaborative, product-driven, agile software development environment.
  • Experience in collaboratively managing and growing diverse and inclusive software development teams that work together in cross-functional team settings - with engineers, UX specialists, and product managers as strong collaborators.
  • Experience managing a hybrid/remote software engineering team.
  • Experience contributing to the empowerment of team members and the product team.
  • Established interpersonal and external communication, collaboration, and conflict mitigation skills.
  • Proficient written and verbal communication skills in English.

Benefits

  • Active collaboration guided by our values: participation, diversity, free and open access, equity, sustainability and respectful collaboration
  • 30 vacation days and additional time off on Dec. 24th and New Year's Eve, public transport ticket, access to our company pension scheme allowance, continued salary in the event of sick children
  • ‚Ç¨ 300 gross per year (‚Ç¨ 25 per month) allowance for running costs in the home office
  • WorkingAbroad@WMDE up to 4 weeks per year
  • All overtime is recorded and converted into compensatory time off
  • Hybrid work options and an office located in the center of Berlin
  • In-house training and continued professional development, as well as free external life coaching (professional advice and coaching on job-related and private issues)

Interested?

Please send us your detailed application documents (Resume & Motivational Letter (yes, we read them)) via our job portal until 31st October 2025. We kindly ask you to refrain from application photos and information on date of birth, marital status and parents.

Wikimedia Germany is committed to equal opportunities and does not discriminate on the basis of, for example, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or belief, political or other convictions, gender, age, disability, or sexual identity. We would like to address you in the way which feels most comfortable for you so please share your preferred name and pronouns if you wish.

data.description:

Your Profile

  • Analytical mindset with experience driving data-informed decision-making.
  • Ability to lead transformation and change management initiatives in dynamic, fast-paced environments.
  • Fluency in English; German or additional languages are an advantage.

Why Us?

data.title: Junior Events & Marketing Manager (f/m/d)
data.description:
adjoe is redefining the future of mobile ads. At the same time, we‚Äôre breaking into programmatic advertising with the intelligent bidding system of adjoe Ads. Together, this ecosystem connects app developers to over 600 million users worldwide for scalable growth. Backed by a $100 million investment from Bertelsmann and operating from offices in Hamburg, Boston, Singapore, and Tokyo, adjoe is defining the next stages of app and ad experience ‚Äì right now. What You Will Do:

  • Support the planning and execution of internal and external events and collaboration with various stakeholders. Your main focus will be on internal cultural events such as Hackathon, quarterly team events, afterworks, etc.
  • Assist with logistics (venue, vendors, travel, materials) and coordinate with partners, agencies, and organizers under senior team guidance.
  • Help prepare budgets, track expenses, and ensure smooth coordination with finance and operations teams.
  • Collaborate with Marketing, Sales, and People teams to ensure events align with employer branding, business and culture objectives.
  • Maintain timelines, checklists, and project trackers to ensure all event tasks are completed on schedule.
  • Collect feedback and performance data after events and improve processes and documentation to support future planning and team efficiency.
  • Support adjoe teams on travel arrangements via our travel management system, Travelperk.
  • You will be our main stakeholder for creating an internal Merch strategy used for employees including, planning, tracking, and distributing.

Who You Are:

  • You‚Äôre detail-oriented and highly organized, making sure nothing falls through the cracks.
  • You take initiative and ask questions, always looking to understand the why behind the work.
  • You communicate clearly and follow through on responsibilities with reliability and accountability.
  • You‚Äôre a strong team player, open to feedback and able to support multiple stakeholders.
  • You stay calm under pressure and manage timelines effectively, even during busy event periods.
  • You bring enthusiasm and creativity into each project, always looking for ways to make the experience more engaging.
  • You take ownership of your tasks while staying closely aligned with more senior event managers.
  • You are eager to learn about event strategy, branding, project management, and how events contribute to business goals.
  • You help build smooth workflows and contribute ideas to improve how the team plans and runs events.
  • You can think on your feet and are ready to come up with pragmatic solutions to suggest to the team at the drop of a hat to make sure everything runs smoothly.

Fuel for the Journey: Benefits to Support Your Ambitions

  • Invest in Your Future: Regular feedback and our development program support your growth, helping you expand your skillset and achieve your career goals.
  • Easy Arrival to adjoe: From signing to settling in Hamburg, we‚Äôve got you covered. Need a visa? No problem. Ready to build your new life and career at adjoe in Hamburg? We support every ambition‚Äîfrom learning German to a relocation bonus that helps you settle in and make Hamburg feel like home.
  • Live Your Best Life, at Work and Beyond: We work in a hybrid setup with 3 core office days, plus flexible working hours. Enjoy 30 vacation days, 3 weeks of remote work per year, and free access to an in-house gym with lots of different fitness classes and mental health support through our Employee Assistance Program (EAP).
  • Thrive Where You Work: Enjoy the Alster lake view from our central office with top-notch equipment, fun open spaces, and a large variety of snacks and drinks.
  • Join the Community! Participate in regular team and company events, including hackathons and social gatherings. We work together, and we celebrate together, too.

data.title: (Senior) Web Frontend Engineer (f/m/d)
data.description:
Position Description

As a Senior Web Frontend Engineer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining Web Frontends for our innovative SaaS offerings. The products you are building will enable customers to experience the future of digital media experiences. It lets them bring any content to any device with our highly innovative technology.

In this role, you will:

  • Develop and maintain SaaS solutions working closely with product owners and UX in an agile environment.
  • Create reusable and maintainable React components using JSX syntax, JavaScript, and TypeScript to build the user interface of web applications
  • Manage component state using React's built-in state management, context API, or state management libraries like Redux with TypeScript typings to ensure type safety and maintainabilit
  • Produce high quality code and work according to modern agile software craftsmanship and testing approaches.
  • Keep yourself on top of latest developments and understand and apply the latest trends in the industry
  • Mentor and coach your team colleagues to grow

What you will need to succeed:

  • Proven experience in front-end development in an agile environment
  • Deep knowledge in React, JS/TS and the web ecosystem
  • Professional experience writing software and leading teams technically
  • Fluent written and verbal English skills

data.title: Working Student Product Management (d/w/m)
data.description:
Introduction

Are you a true data nerd with a strong background in business administration, economics, or mathematics? Are you looking for a position where you can live out your passion for digital business models while learning how to build software products that delight thousands of users? Then orderbird is the right place for you!

We're looking for a working student in Product Management to help our teams develop our products based on data.

Sounds exciting? Karo and our Head of Product, Jan, look forward to receiving your application, including a fun fact about you!

By the way: With over 17,000 customers ‚Äì restaurants, caf√©s, bars, clubs, ice cream parlors, and beer gardens ‚Äìorderbird is one of the leading POS systems for the hospitality industry in Europe.

What you can look forward to

  • You'll be the right hand of our Head of Product, working closely with our engineering, design, and business teams. You'll get to understand how all areas of the company pull together to deliver great products.
  • From Theory to Practice: You'll learn how to guide a product lifecycle from the initial idea to launch.
  • Gain practical insights into how SaaS products are developed and scaled, coached directly by the Head of Product
  • We have no dress code, and we're an international team, so everyone is welcome!
  • Now for the real bonus: Office dogs! Depending on the day and the number of people in the office, a whole pack of them might be running around.
  • A newly renovated nest in Berlin-Kreuzberg with a rooftop terrace!
  • Every Wednesday, we have a virtual breakfast meeting with updates from various teams. In our Breakfast Update, you'll find out what's happening in the company and get to know the new Birds‚Äîcomplete with fun facts!
  • Flat hierarchies, fast decision-making, and a committed and friendly team ‚Äì we know everyone writes that, but it's really true for us :)

Among other tasks you will be working on

  • Assisting with market analysis and feature prioritization. At the same time, you'll have the opportunity to manage your own smaller projects from start to finish
  • Data analysis is your second name: You'll dive deep into our data to find out what our customers really need. Using tools like Google Analytics and other BI tools, you'll build dashboards that provide us with key insights
  • Actively helping to develop the 2026 product roadmap with the Head of Product and our CTO to ensure we create the greatest value for our customers

What you bring along for this role

  • You're currently enrolled in a degree program, ideally with a focus on economics, business administration, mathematics, or a similar data-heavy subject
  • Optional: Initial experience with analytics and BI tools
  • An analytical mindset and the ability to prepare complex data in an easy-to-understand way
  • Initial experience at an agency, in venture building, or in performance marketing is a plus
  • An interest in SaaS and the hospitality industry
  • You're reliable, proactive, and eager to continuously develop your skills

data.title: Working Student Lab
data.description:
About Flora Food Group

We offer consumers a compelling choice in four growing categories: butters and spreads, creams, liquids and cheeses. We hold leadership positions in many of the 100 countries we operate in, with iconic brands including Flora, Becel+ProActiv, Blue Band, Country Crock, I Can't Believe It's Not Butter, Rama, and Violife, together with our local brands and Professional business.  

Global branded food champion Flora Food Group, offers the next generation of delicious, natural, nutritious food. Our products are more affordable and more sustainable than their dairy equivalents.  

 

 

Werden Sie Werkstundent*in (m/w/d) in unserem Werk in Kleve & gestalten Sie gemeinsam aktiv mit unserem engagierten Technikteam die Zukunft.

 

√úber die Position:

Die Arbeitspl√§tze in unserem Labor sind genauso vielf√§ltig wie unsere Rezepturen & Produkte. Von dem Umpacken und Einlagern von Proben zur Weiterverarbeitung bis zum Ansetzen von einfachen mikrobiologischen Proben hast du mehrere Aufgaben im Labor. Dazu geh√∂rt auch die selbstst√§ndige Durchf√ºhrung von chemischen und physikalischen Proben. Dabei hast Du die hohen Hygiene-, Sicherheits- und Qualit√§tsstandards immer im Blick. Mit deinem technischen Verst√§ndnis, deiner Berufserfahrung und deiner Einsatzbereitschaft hast Du alles, was Du brauchst, um nach einer entsprechenden Einarbeitungszeit, selbstst√§ndig zu agieren und das Team tatkr√§ftig zu unterst√ºtzen.

 

Was braucht es also, um in dieser Rolle erfolgreich zu sein?

  • Du bist eingeschriebene*r Student*in an einer Hochschule/Universit√§t
  • Du hattest im besten Fall schon Ber√ºhrungspunkte mit einer Laborumgebung oder im Bereich Lebensmittel
  • Du verf√ºgst √ºber gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
  • Du bist k√∂rperlich belastbar
  • Du bist zuverl√§ssig und hohe Einsatzbereitschaft
  • Zu dem besitzt Du ein Hygiene- und Qualit√§tsbewusstsein.

 

Mit Spa√ü an der Arbeit in einem schnelllebigen Umfeld, Entschlossenheit sowie der notwendigen Eigenverantwortung, hast Du alles, was Du brauchst, um etwas zu bewirken.

 

Wir bieten

  • sichere & attraktive Verg√ºtung gem√§√ü Tarifvertrag
  • 30 Tage Urlaub
  • Sonderzahlungen, wie z.B. 13. Monatsgehalt und Urlaubsgeld
  • w√∂chentliche kostenlose Massage
  • frisches Obst, Getr√§nkespender, Kaffee- und Snackautomaten
  • pers√∂nliche Gestaltungs- und Entwicklungsm√∂glichkeiten
  • ein eigenes Parkhaus, in dem man kostenlos parken kann

 

√úber Flora Food Group:

Unser Ziel bei Flora Food Group ist klar: Wir machen die Menschen ges√ºnder und gl√ºcklicher mit nahrhaften und k√∂stlichen, nat√ºrlichen, pflanzlichen Produkten, die gut f√ºr Sie und unseren Planeten sind und mit Verpackungen frei von Plastik. 

Wir haben kultige Marken wie L√§tta, Rama, Becel, Country Crock, Blue Band und Flora, die Menschen auf der ganzen Welt kennen und lieben. Wir sind seit 1871 ein vertrauensw√ºrdiger Marktf√ºhrer in der Branche und doch haben wir das Gef√ºhl, dass wir gerade erst am Anfang stehen.

Leistung, Leidenschaft und Sorgfalt definieren, wer wir als Unternehmen sind, wie wir jeden Tag arbeiten und welche Verantwortung wir gegen√ºber unseren Mitarbeitern, unseren Verbrauchern, unseren Gesch√§ftspartnern und unserer Welt empfinden.

Wir haben gro√üe Ambitionen, dieses Gesch√§ft auszubauen und wollen die richtigen Leute anziehen - diejenigen, die lieben, was sie tun, die von Verantwortung leben und nach beruflichen Perspektiven suchen, die ihre Zukunft bestimmen

 

Was sind die weiteren Schritte?:

Wenn Dich diese Rolle interessiert und Du dich damit identifizieren kannst, dann bewerbe Dich und f√ºlle unten unser Bewerbungsformular aus oder sende uns Deine Bewerbung per Mail an Jan-Philipp Pau, freue mich auf deine Bewerbung!

 

 

We understand your resume might not be up to date and recommend that you apply with what you have or your LinkedIn Profile. Flora Food Group is dedicated to building an inclusive and diverse workplace, we understand that you might not meet all the requirements stated in the description, but we encourage you to apply anyway. You might be the right candidate for this role or other roles.‚ÄØ 

Flora Food Group is an employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace and equal opportunities for all. We recruit based only on values, qualifications, performance, skills, behaviours, experience, and knowledge. We ensure job advertisements are free from unintentional bias.  

No personal characteristics should be a barrier to joining Flora Food Group. We prohibit discrimination and harassment based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or other personal characteristics.

data.description:
Are you dissatisfied with doing the same three tasks every day? Are you thriving in a small company environment acting as reliable team player? Do you want to continuously grow in your work scope and skills? Then becoming our next IT guru might be just right for you!

Tasks

What you can achieve with us:

  • You are the sole responsible for our cloud services
  • You develop software in cooperation with our external partner
  • You support our internal project managers on their clinical trial projects with data management and data quality control
  • You are the go-to person for our IT admin, including helpdesk and device management

Requirements

How you can succeed with us:

  • You are fluent in all things AWS, Docker container, Chef and virtual machines on Linux
  • You can prove deep knowledge of Ruby (optional: Rails), JavaScript, SAS and R
  • You know MS 365 (AAD, Intune) inside and out
  • You are interested in medical imaging formats and working within highly regulated environments

Benefits

We want you to feel valued, welcomed and acknowledged: our international team will support you throughout your career with us and our management will organise regular feedback talks to ensure expectations are met and opportunities realised. We welcome you in our fully equipped Berlin office where you can shape your working hours to your individual needs OR help you setting up a home office anywhere in Germany (if you want an employment contract) or anywhere in the EU (if you prefer a contractor/freelance engagement). Most of all, we want to create a good work atmosphere for you: we value personal relationships with our employees, accommodating their needs and wishes, fostering an authentic cooperation based on trust and respect for each other.

We will take applications throughout the whole of October and will then interview during October and November. We are looking to hire from December onwards, latest during January next year.

We are aware that this profile has a broad scope: we are open to either work with one person who is a generalist all-rounder OR working with two people who can combine amongst each other. Please tell us in your cover letter where you see yourself and where your interests lie!

data.title: Werkstudent Account Management- 100% Remote (m/w/d)
data.description:
Jobbeschreibung

Du stehst kurz vor dem Studienabschluss, willst in Client Relations durchstarten und suchst ein Unternehmen, in dem du dich langfristig entwickeln willst? Du kommunizierst selbstsicher in Videocalls, arbeitest organisiert und interessierst dich f√ºr Online Marketing und Social Media? Bei uns findest du deinen Einstieg in Client Relations in einem der Top-IT-Unternehmen Deutschlands!

Wer ist Digistore24?

Wir sind eines der am schnellsten wachsenden Technologie-Unternehmen Europas.
Das treibt uns an: We shape the digital future! Unsere Mission ist es, mit unserer Software Menschen zu erm√§chtigen, ihr Wissen online mit anderen zu teilen, um sich den Traum von einem eigenen Business zu erf√ºllen. Dadurch erhalten Millionen von Menschen Zugang zu Informationen, die es ihnen erm√∂glichen, ihre Ziele zu erreichen.
Um mit unserem Wachstum gleichzuziehen, haben wir den Anspruch, unsere Teams nachhaltig auszubauen. Dabei legen wir Wert darauf, mit Experten und starken Pers√∂nlichkeiten zu arbeiten, die unsere Werte teilen - unabh√§ngig von ihrem Wohnort.

Dein neuer Studijob

  • Kundenkommunikation: Kontaktiere Kunden empathisch und l√∂sungsorientiert zur Kl√§rung und Korrektur von Problemen ‚Äì schriftlich und sp√§ter auch im Videocall. Mit deiner Unterst√ºtzung k√∂nnen digitale KMU ihre Produkte unb√ºrokratisch √ºber uns verkaufen und du wirst ein Pro in B2B-Kommunikation.
  • Produktpr√ºfungen: √úberpr√ºfe Produkte, die Kunden in unserer Software anlegen, anhand festgelegter Qualit√§tskriterien und identifiziere nicht konforme Produkte. So tr√§gst du dazu bei, dass wir unseren exzellenten Ruf bewahren.
  • Projektassistenz im Bereich Account Management: √úbernimm mittelfristig eigene Projekte. So lernst du von unserem erfahrenen Team das volle Spektrum an Projekten in Client Relations und sp√§ter auch Account Management.
  • Unterst√ºtzung im Kundensupport: Beantworte einfache Anfragen. So machst du unsere Kunden happy und erweiterst dein Online-Marketing- sowie technisches Fachwissen jeden Tag ‚Äì eine super Basis f√ºr langfristige Entwicklung bei uns!
  • Werde unverzichtbar im Client Relations-Team! Entwickle dich mit unserer Hilfe langfristig zum Spezialisten f√ºr Online-Marketing und Software-Anwendungen. Profitiere vom Know-how unserer erfahrenen Account Manager und lerne, Digistore24 professionell zu repr√§sentieren und pers√∂nliche Kundenbeziehungen aufzubauen.

Unsere Werte

Bitte schau dir die Werte WIRKLICH genau an. Bist du bereit diese zu leben?

Stellenanforderungen

Deine Superkr√§fte

  • Kommunikationsf√§higkeit: Du hast gute schriftliche und m√ºndliche Ausdrucksf√§higkeit und kannst einen starken Auftritt im Videocall hinlegen ‚Äì auch wenn ein CEO am anderen Ende ist.
  • Analytisches Denken: Du kannst Daten und Excel-Listen auswerten und interpretieren bzw. sp√§ter bei Umsatzr√ºckg√§ngen deiner Kunden deren Hintergr√ºnde analysieren und L√∂sungen vorschlagen.
  • Begeisterung f√ºr moderne Technologie & Interesse an Online-Marketing: Du arbeitest dich schnell in neue digitale Tools ein, Social Media ist dein t√§glich Brot und Grundkenntnisse in Office-Anwendungen bringst du bereits mit.
  • Eigenst√§ndigkeit & Zuverl√§ssigkeit: Im Homeoffice arbeitest du strukturiert, verl√§sslich und kannst eigenverantwortlich Priorit√§ten setzen, um deine Ziele zu erreichen und Deadlines einzuhalten. Du hast Spa√ü daran, dich in verschiedene Aufgaben einzuarbeiten.
  • Genauigkeit: Mit deiner sorgf√§ltigen Arbeitsweise bei der Pr√ºfung von Produktlisten haben nicht konforme Produkte keine Chance.

Dieser Job ist NICHT f√ºr dich geeignet, wenn du

  • ‚Ä¶ kein immatrikulierter Student bist.
  • ‚Ä¶ dazu neigst, Dinge zu √ºbersehen und nicht detailorientiert arbeitest.
  • ‚Ä¶ dich mit der Planung und Priorisierung deiner Aufgaben schwertust.
  • ‚Ä¶ nicht mit moderner Software arbeiten willst.

Dein Start im Product Development Team bei More Nutrition!

  • Du arbeitest eng mit Procurement, Produktentwicklung, Qualit√§tsmanagement und unseren Rohstoffherstellern zusammen

  • Du passt Rezepturen an und entwickelst sie gezielt weiter, wenn ein Rohstoff nicht 1:1 ersetzt werden kann

Deine Erfahrung & Skills

  • Du hast ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der Ern√§hrungswissenschaften, √ñkotrophologie, Lebensmittelchemie, Lebensmitteltechnologie, oder eine vergleichbare Berufsausbildung (einschlie√ülich B√§cker / Konditor)
  • Du bringst idealerweise 2‚Äì3 Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Produktentwicklung mit (Pluspunkte sind Erfahrungen im Bereich Nahrungserg√§nzungsmittel, zuckerfreie, proteinangereicherte Lebensmittel oder Riegel sowie erste F√ºhrungserfahrung)

  • Du hast ein hohes Bewusstsein f√ºr Labor- und Arbeitssicherheit

Warum wir?

Teil unseres Teams zu sein, bedeutet, Teil eines leistungsstarken Unternehmens mit einer vielf√§ltigen Kultur zu sein. In unserem schnell wachsenden Team von √ºber 1.200 Mitarbeitenden vereinen wir unsere Leidenschaft f√ºr Sports Nutrition, Supplements und gesunden Nahrungsmitteln mit modernster Technologie, Produktions- und Logistikprozessen. All das dient einem Ziel: Unseren Kunden erstklassige Produkte f√ºr ihren gesunden und sportlichen Lifestyle zu bieten.

Dich erwartet ein starker Teamzusammenhalt, stetige M√∂glichkeiten, dich professionell weiterzuentwickeln und Verantwortung zu √ºbernehmen, sowie ein spannender Berufsalltag zwischen Lifestyle und Job. Mit Standorten in Hamburg, Elmshorn, Kaltenkirchen/N√ºtzen und Elsdorf bietet TQG vielf√§ltige Karrierem√∂glichkeiten in Bereichen wie Technologie, Produktentwicklung, Vertrieb, Marketing und Logistik. √úber uns

The Quality Group (TQG) ist ein innovativer Anbieter von Sportern√§hrungsprodukten und vereint seit 2021 die erfolgreichen Marken ESN und More Nutrition.

ESN ist seit 2004 deutscher Marktf√ºhrer f√ºr Sportern√§hrung und bietet Produkte wie Proteinpulver, Riegel und Supplements, die auf ambitionierte Fitnessziele ausgerichtet sind. More Nutrition, gegr√ºndet 2017, steht f√ºr gesunde, zuckerreduzierte Ern√§hrungsprodukte und bietet L√∂sungen f√ºr bewusste Ern√§hrung und Gewichtsmanagement ‚Äì ohne Verzicht.

Mit Leidenschaft und Innovationskraft entwickelt das Unternehmen hochwertige Produkte, die Gesundheit, Leistung und Lebensfreude f√∂rdern. Mit einer agilen Unternehmenskultur und spannenden Karrierem√∂glichkeiten ist TQG nicht nur f√ºr Kunden, sondern auch f√ºr Mitarbeitende ein starker Partner.

data.title: Expert Conversion Rate Optimization (m/w/d)
data.description:
Stell dir vor, es ist dein erster Tag als Expert Conversion Rate Optimization (m/w/d) bei ABRIO. Du wirst herzlich von einem motivierten Team empfangen. Nach einem ersten gemeinsamen Team-Lunch tauchst du direkt in die Welt des E-Commerce ein: spannende Projekte, f√ºhrende Marken aus D2C, B2C und B2B und jede Menge Raum, um deine Test- und Optimierungsstrategien in die Tat umzusetzen.

Du merkst sofort: Hier kannst du deine analytische Expertise mit deiner Leidenschaft f√ºr Conversion-Optimierung verbinden. Du entwickelst und steuerst A/B-Tests, analysierst Nutzerverhalten und leitest daraus konkrete Handlungsempfehlungen ab. Dein Ziel: die Performance unserer Kunden messbar steigern ‚Äì von der ersten Hypothese bis zur erfolgreichen Umsetzung.

ABRIO ist eine der f√ºhrenden Digital Commerce Beratungen mit Sitz in Frankfurt am Main. Unser Ziel: Die E-Commerce-Welt unserer Kunden nachhaltig zu verbessern und skalierbare Erfolge zu schaffen. Dabei kombinieren wir modernste Technologien mit innovativen Ans√§tzen und ma√ügeschneiderten L√∂sungen ‚Äì und Conversion Rate Optimization spielt f√ºr uns dabei eine zentrale Rolle.

Aufgaben

Beratung:

  • Beratung unterschiedlicher Kunden hinsichtlich Strategie, Priorisierung und Umsetzung von CRO-Ma√ünahmen.

  • Entwicklung datengetriebener Hypothesen sowie Ableitung von Ma√ünahmen zur Optimierung der Onlineshops unserer Kunden.

Optimierung von Conversion Rates:

  • Durchf√ºhrung von Analysen zur Conversion-Performance (z.‚ÄØB. auf Websites, Online-Shops, Landingpages) mittels Analytics- und Reportingtools.
  • Nutzerbefragungen und Beobachtungen mit Heat Maps (Microsoft Clarity, Hotjar).
  • Konzeption, Durchf√ºhrung und Auswertung von A/B-Tests (z.B. √ºber Kameleoon, ABlyft, AB Tasty).

Reporting und Ergebnisse:

  • Erstellung von Reports und Pr√§sentationen f√ºr interne und externe Stakeholder (Excel und PowerPoint).

  • Proaktive Generierung und Auswertung von Kunden-Insights, um strategische und operative Entscheidungen zu unterst√ºtzen.

Zusammenarbeit:

  • Zusammenarbeit mit unserem Developmentteam zur technischen Implementierung und zum Testing von Optimierungsma√ünahmen.

Qualifikation

IT'S A MATCH, SOFERN DU...

  • ein abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Betriebswirtschaftslehre, Wirtschaftsmathematik oder Statistik, Marktforschung, Online-Marketing, E-Commerce oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation mitbringst.
  • 3 - 5 Jahre Erfahrung idealerweise im Bereich Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO), Digital Analytics, UX/UI Design, Performance Marketing oder einer √§hnlichen Disziplin gesammelt hast. Entscheidend ist vor allem echte Leidenschaft f√ºr das Thema CRO.
  • Reporting, Datenanalysen und Visualisierungen zu deinen St√§rken z√§hlst ‚Äì insbesondere mit Excel, PowerPoint, Google Analytics, Hotjar und Microsoft Clarity.
  • du A/B Testing nicht als Buzzword nutzt, sondern als gelebte Praxis einsetzt ‚Äì idealerweise mit Tools wie ABlyft.
  • du strukturiert und datengetrieben arbeitest und ein gutes Verst√§ndnis f√ºr Daten und Nutzerverhalten hast.
  • dich selbst als analytisch und zahlenaffin beschreibst sowie kommunikationsstark bist, um komplexe Datenanalysen verst√§ndlich zu pr√§sentieren.
  • dich mit Shopsystemen auskennst ‚Äì Shopify ist ein Plus.

Benefits

    Wir sind stolz auf unsere positive Arbeitsatmosph√§re, gepr√§gt durch Offenheit, Miteinander und coole Teamevents. Ob Afterwork-Drinks, Team-Lunches oder gemeinsame Aktivit√§ten ‚Äì bei uns wird der Zusammenhalt gelebt.

So ist es unsere Mission, mit intuitiver, KI-getriebener Software das Management des Energieverbrauchs so einfach zu machen, dass es f√ºr wirklich jeden ‚Äì egal ob Unternehmen oder Privathaushalt ‚Äì zu einer Selbstverst√§ndlichkeit wird und Energieversorger und Unternehmenskunden wirksam sowohl Energieverbrauch als auch CO2-Fu√üabdruck reduzieren k√∂nnen. So machen wir mit unseren derzeit 35 talentierten Kollegen und Kolleginnen die Digitalisierung der Energiebranche zu einer echten Chance.

Aufgaben

Du bist der/die erste Ansprechpartner:in bei internen, technischen Fragen und √ºbernimmst gleichzeitig Supportaufgaben bei unseren Kund:innen. Dazu stehst Du in engem Austausch mit unserem Projektmanagement- und Entwicklerteam und arbeitest unserem erfahrenen System Administrator aktiv zu. In einem flexiblen Umfeld hilfst Du bei Wissensaufbau und -verteilung zu Themen rund um Deployment und arbeitest mit spannenden Technologien wie pfSense, OPSI, Proxmox, Bareos oder Ansible. Du unterst√ºtzt auch beim Aufbau und Betrieb von verteilten Cloud-Architekturen mit Docker und Kubernetes.

  • Du betreust alle im Haus befindlichen Systeme (Atlassian Jira und Confluence, Gitlab, E-Mail, Produkt- und Entwicklungsserver) sowie remote der GreenPocket-Systeme bei Kunden, in verschiedenen Rechenzentren & Unterst√ºtzung im 3rd-Level Support der GreenPocket-Software

Qualifikation

data.title: Head of UX (all genders)
data.description:
At Wikimedia Deutschland e.V. we help create, collect and distribute free knowledge. In 2004, volunteer Wikipedia activists founded the non-profit association Wikimedia Deutschland in Berlin, which now consists of over 110,000 members and 180 full-time staff.

Free knowledge leads to a fairer world. Wikipedia is the most important online knowledge collection of our time. The German Wikipedia alone records almost 1 billion page views per month for a total of 3 million articles. We - Wikimedia Deutschland e. V. - support the volunteers of Wikipedia and its sister projects, develop free software, such as Wikidata, and advocate for free access to knowledge, the opening of education and research, and more common good orientation in data policy.

For our UX Team, based in Berlin, we are looking for a permanent Head of UX (all genders), full-time (40 hours / week) as soon as possible.

This position is designed as a hybrid working model with regular presence in our Berlin office.

Tasks

You will be leading the diverse team of designers and researchers working to make Wikidata, Wikibase, and Wikipedia more user-driven and user-friendly.

The mission of the UX team is to deliver quality open source tools that empower users to contribute to the Wikimedia movement, regardless of their background or ability.

What you‚Äôll be doing:

  • Lead a multifunctional team of 9 UX Designers and Researchers that are distributed across 7 cross-functional product teams.
  • Review existing and establish new processes to improve the
    team's operations internally and in their cross-functional
    collaboration.
  • Be a sparring partner for your team, providing regular 1:1 guidance and feedback to help them thrive in their work.
  • Create clear development paths and facilitate advancement for each team member through their personal development plan.
  • Team up with the Product, Engineering and Software
    Communication Leadership to shape how UX is better incorporated into the
    cross-functional work.
  • Bring the UX perspective to strategic conversations within the
    department and organization, while advocating for user-centered
    practices.
  • Manage design resources and coordinate budgets across teams.

Requirements

  • You have comprehensive knowledge of UX design and research practice, demonstrated by several years of experience in the software industry.
  • You have proven experience managing a UX team. You are skilled in people management and build trust by generating mutual understanding, as well as transparent and proactive communication.
  • You have supported and guided the professional development journey of a UX team.
  • You are comfortable defining and executing strategic design direction in complex product ecosystems with high interdependencies.
  • You can resolve complex situations involving many stakeholders through effective decision-making and diplomatic leadership.
  • You have proficient written and verbal communication skills in English. You have at least medium verbal communication skills in German.

Benefits

  • Active collaboration guided by our values: participation, diversity, free and open access, equity, sustainability and respectful collaboration
  • 30 vacation days and additional time off on Dec. 24th and New Year's Eve, public transport ticket, access to our company pension scheme allowance, continued salary in the event of sick children
  • ‚Ç¨ 500 gross one-off payment for home office equipment
  • ‚Ç¨ 300 gross per year (‚Ç¨ 25 per month) allowance for running costs in the home office
  • WorkingAbroad@WMDE up to 4 weeks per year
  • All overtime is recorded and converted into compensatory time off
  • Hybrid work options and an office located in the center of Berlin
  • In-house training and continued professional development, as well as free external life coaching (professional advice and coaching on job-related and private issues)

Interested?

Please send us your detailed application documents (Resume & Motivational Letter (yes, we read them)) via our job portal. We kindly ask you to refrain from application photos and information on date of birth, marital status and parents.

Wikimedia Germany is committed to equal opportunities and does not discriminate on the basis of, for example, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or belief, political or other convictions, gender, age, disability, or sexual identity. We would like to address you in the way which feels most comfortable for you so please share your preferred name and pronouns if you wish.

  • Umzugsstress?: Nicht mit uns - nach Absprache √ºbernehmen wir gern die Kosten Deines Umzugs mit einer steuerfreien Umzugspauschale bis zu einer H√∂he von 964‚Ç¨

  • Optional Pfade vorbereiten: Multiuser-Machbarkeit (Netcode/Relay ‚Äì Spike) und VR-Route (OpenXR-Check) skizzieren.

Qualifikation

Dein Profil

  • Nice to have: BIM/IFC-Basics, Revit-Export, Speckle, glTFast, Addressables; Netcode/Relay; Shader-Basics; etwas Python f√ºrs Pre-Processing.
  • KI-Nutzung & Tooling: Du setzt Tools wie ChatGPT f√ºr Recherche, Doku, Testskripte & Spike-Planung sinnvoll ein.
  • Deutsch mind. B2 (Doku/Interviews), Englisch f√ºr Tech-Ressourcen.
